hanzi-su-wiki:
羅

Значения

Тонкая ткань; располагаться в ряд

Мнемоника

Нитяная 糸 сеть 罒 из тонкой ткани для ловли птиц 隹.

Варианты

罗
purpleculture_pinyin:
luó
surname Luo; gauze; to collect; to gather; to catch; to sift
фамилия Луо; марля; собирать; собирать; ловить; просеивать
rtega_mnemonic:
羅羅RS
罗罗		net for catching birds, gauze, spread out
  • a net 罒 tied to catch birds 維: silk net spread out between trees
  • ⓢ net 罒 placed at night 夕 for catching birds
purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 罗)
Ideographic: A silk 糹 net 罒 for catching birds 隹
purpleculture_examples:
羅馬 [ luó mǎ ]: Rome, capital of Italy
羅盤 [ luó pán ]: compass
羅鍋 [ luó guō ]: humpbacked (e.g. a bridge); in the form of an arch; a hunchback
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿱ Above to below
    • 罒 [ wǎng ] net, network
    • 維 [ wéi ] to preserve, to maintain, to hold together
heisig_chinese_memo: Lots of girls in Japan wear silk gauze patches over one eye to maintain eye health. &nbsp
heisig_constituent: gauze, eye, cross-eyed, net, fibre, thread, spiderman, turkey
koohiiStory1: Lots of girls in Japan wear gauze patches over one eye made of course white fibers. They think it is cute, and I must admit, I have come to think so too.
koohiiStory2: Rocky won the match but left with a nasty eye injury, and needs some gauze for it. I use a modified version of the Rocky theme song to remember this one -- "the eye and the fiber".
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: You have a net of thread for catching a turkey. But, it must be spread out and you must arrange it first.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: The reason you'd use a net made of thread is because it's hard to see. But, it's only that way when you spread out the net. It's important to spread out and arrange your net otherwise the turkey will see it.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: You spread out your net and arrange it just so. You expect it to catch a turkey, but instead you catch the ancient Egyptian god Ra (ら).
WaniKani_Reading_Info: "Let me out of this net!" says Ra. "You arranged and spread it out just right so I couldn't see it!"
Ru_Meaning: gauze, thin silk, Rome, arrange, spread out
Ru_Radicals: 小 (маленький), 幺 (короткая нить), 買 (покупать), 糸 (нить), 隹 (старая птица)
Ru_trainchinese:
luó: (сущ/глаг/сч.слово) сито, решето; просеивать; двенадцать дюжин, гросс
luó: (графема) сеть (для ловли птиц); ловить (птиц); выставлять; собирать; тонкий шелк, газ
Kanshudo_mnemonic: a net (罒) of fibre (維) is a gauze
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Rich Chinese people like to put silk gauze over their eyes in the evening because they think it will make them more beautiful.
humanum_full_description_en:
Oracle from " net " from "隹". Later, the symbol "糸" was added and written " Luo ". Oracle is used as the name of the country. For example, "Collection" 880 is: "Yi Mao Bu, Zhengding (Zhen): Purpose 𢦔䍜." Inscriptions on inscriptions are used as names. For example, Luo Ergui: "Luoer □, Wu Wangzhi's surname (nephew)." " er " is the suffix of a person's name commonly used in the Spring and Autumn Period.

The original meaning of " Luo " is a net for catching birds. "Er Ya. Shiqi": "Birds are called Luo." Such as "Poetry. Wang Feng. "Tuyao": "There are rabbits, but the pheasants are away from Luo." Mao Chuan: "The bird net is for Luo." "Han Feizi. "Difficulty Three": "If the world is the best, the bird will not lose it."

" Luo " also means catching birds with a net. "Shuowen": "Luo, Yisiguan bird." Such as "Poetry. Xiaoya. "Mandarin Duck": "Mandarin Duck Yu Fei, Bi Zhiluo Zhi." "Confucius Family Language. "Six Books": "Confucius who sees the sparrows gets all the yellow-mouthed sparrows."

" Luo " means including and inclusive. Such as "Zhuangzi. "World under Heaven": "Everything is biluo, nothing is enough to return. The ancient Taoism has the truth." Cheng Xuanying said: "Including the common things, including the universe." He also said to incur and attract. Such as "Han Shu. "Wang Mang Chuan 1": "Survey the world's talents, thousands of people before and after."

" Luo " means arrangement and distribution. "Guang Ya. Shi Xu Yi: "Luo, Lie Ye." Such as "Han Shu. "Astronomical History": "There is a sentence of nine stars in the west, listed in three places: one is Tianqi, second is Tianyuan, and third is Jiuyi." "Selected Works. Yang Ziyun "Chang Yang Fu": "Luo Qiancheng rides on Lin Mang, and Wan rides on the mountain corner."

" Luo " is a sparse and soft silk fabric. "Guang Yun. Song Yun: "Luo, Luo Qi also." Such as "Chu Ci. "Calling the Soul": "Jiu Abubi, Luo Qi is more open." Wang Yi's note: "Luo, Qi belongs to Ye. Zhang, Shi Ye. In the room, there is a thin bed with konjac seats, four walls and Qu Yu Fu Shi Luo. It's light and cool." "Huainanzi. "Main skill": "I entered the ancestral temple through the armor, and was led by the army by Luo Wan, and he was born because of the loss of happiness."

" Lo " through " suffering ", expressed encounter. Such as "Han Shu. "Juan Shu Yu Xue Ping Peng Chuan": "Luo grammarists do not hate in the public decision." Yan Shi Gu's note: "Luo, suffer also, suffer." "Lun Heng. "Differentiation": "There may be a crime, a violation of the county official, Luo Li's criminal law, not because of the past, but the family has a negative."

" Lo " is also a fine sieve, with " basket ." Such as "Qi Min Yao Shu.柰林檎": "Into the water, even more criticized, using Luo Luo to peel off the skin." Song Yingxing of the Ming Dynasty "Tiangong Kaiwu. "Quite Essence": "After the wheat has been milled, it will enter Luo several times, and the diligent will not tire of repeating it." It is also used as a verb to indicate the use of Luo to screen things. For example, Bai Juyi of the Tang Dynasty: "Shixiangluo medicine gas, warm roasted tea smoke."
humanum_short_description_en: Oracle from " net " from "隹". Later, the symbol "糸" was added and written " Luo ". The original meaning is a net for catching birds.
humanum_full_description:
甲骨文從「网」從「隹」。後增意符「糸」，寫作「羅」。甲骨文用作方國名。如《合集》880正：「乙卯卜，爭鼎（貞）：旨𢦔䍜。」金文用作人名。如羅兒匜：「羅兒□□，吳王之姓（甥）。」「兒」是春秋金文習見的人名後綴。

　　「羅」的本義是捕鳥用的網。《爾雅．釋器》：「鳥罟謂之羅。」如《詩．王風．兔爰》：「有兔爰爰，雉離于羅。」毛傳：「鳥網為羅。」《韓非子．難三》：「以天下為之羅，則雀不失矣。」

　　「羅」也表示張網捕鳥。《說文》：「羅，以絲罟鳥也。」如《詩．小雅．鴛鴦》：「鴛鴦于飛，畢之羅之。」《孔子家語．六本》：「孔子見羅雀者，所得皆黃口小雀。」

　　「羅」表示包括、包羅。如《莊子．天下》：「萬物畢羅，莫足以歸，古之道術有在於是者。」成玄英疏：「包羅庶物，囊括宇內。」又表示招致、招羅。如《漢書．王莽傳上》：「網羅天下異能之士，至者前後千數。」

　　「羅」表示排列、分布。《廣雅．釋詁一》：「羅，列也。」如《漢書．天文志》：「其西有句曲九星，三處羅列：一曰天旗，二曰天苑，三曰九斿。」《文選．楊子雲〈長楊賦〉》：「羅千乘於林莽，列萬騎於山隅。」

　　「羅」是一種稀疏而輕軟的絲織品。《廣韻．歌韻》：「羅，羅綺也。」如《楚辭．招魂》：「蒻阿拂壁，羅幬張些。」王逸注：「羅，綺屬也。張，施也。言房內則以蒻席薄床，四壁及與曲隅復施羅幬，輕且涼也。」《淮南子．主術》：「是猶貫甲冑而入宗廟，被羅紈而從軍旅，失樂之所由生矣。」

　　「羅」通「罹」，表示遭遇。如《漢書．雋疏于薛平彭傳》：「羅文法者于公所決皆不恨。」顏師古注：「羅，罹也，遭也。」《論衡．辨祟》：「或有所犯，抵觸縣官，羅麗刑法，不曰過所致，而曰家有負。」

　　「羅」也是一種細密的篩子，同「籮」。如《齊民要術．柰林檎》：「下水，更抨，以羅漉去皮子。」明代宋應星《天工開物．粹精》：「凡麥經磨之後，幾番入羅，勤者不厭重復。」又作動詞，表示用羅篩東西。如唐代白居易〈即事〉：「室香羅藥氣，籠暖焙茶煙。」
humanum_short_description: 甲骨文從「网」從「隹」。後增意符「糸」，寫作「羅」。本義是捕鳥用的網。

luo2
HSK 5: 逻,邏
羅羅RS
罗罗 		net for catching birds, gauze, spread out
  • a net 罒 tied to catch birds 維: silk net spread out between trees
  • ⓢ net 罒 placed at night 夕 for catching birds
(Simplified: 罗)
Chinese Definition:
Ideographic: A silk 糹 net 罒 for catching birds 隹
  • ⿱ Above to below
    • 罒 [ wǎng ] net, network
    • 維 [ wéi ] to preserve, to maintain, to hold together
①捕鳥的網：羅網。
②張網捕捉：羅掘(用網捕麻雀，挖掘老鼠洞找糧食。喻用盡辦法籌措款項)。門可羅雀(形容門庭冷落)。
③蒐集，招致，包括：羅捕。羅致(招請人才)。網羅。包羅。羅織罪名(虛構罪名，陷害無辜)。
④散佈：羅列。
⑤過濾流質或篩細粉末用的器具：絹羅。
⑥用羅篩東西：羅面。
⑦輕軟有稀孔的絲織品：羅綺。羅扇。
⑧量詞，用於商業，一羅合十二打。
⑨同“腡”。
⑩姓氏。
羅馬 [ luó mǎ ]: Rome, capital of Italy
羅盤 [ luó pán ]: compass
羅鍋 [ luó guō ]: humpbacked (e.g. a bridge); in the form of an arch; a hunchback
(Simplified: 罗)

Kind: traditional

甲骨文從「 网 」從「 隹 」。後增意符「 糸 」，寫作「 羅 」。甲骨文用作方國名。如《合集》880正：「乙卯卜，爭鼎（貞）：旨𢦔䍜。」金文用作人名。如羅兒匜：「羅兒□□，吳王之姓（甥）。」「 兒 」是春秋金文習見的人名後綴。 「 羅 」的本義是捕鳥用的網。《爾雅．釋器》：「鳥罟謂之羅。」如《詩．王風．兔爰》：「有兔爰爰，雉離于羅。」毛傳：「鳥網為羅。」《韓非子．難三》：「以天下為之羅，則雀不失矣。」 「 羅 」也表示張網捕鳥。《說文》：「羅，以絲罟鳥也。」如《詩．小雅．鴛鴦》：「鴛鴦于飛，畢之羅之。」《孔子家語．六本》：「孔子見羅雀者，所得皆黃口小雀。」 「 羅 」表示包括、包羅。如《莊子．天下》：「萬物畢羅，莫足以歸，古之道術有在於是者。」成玄英疏：「包羅庶物，囊括宇內。」又表示招致、招羅。如《漢書．王莽傳上》：「網羅天下異能之士，至者前後千數。」 「 羅 」表示排列、分布。《廣雅．釋詁一》：「羅，列也。」如《漢書．天文志》：「其西有句曲九星，三處羅列：一曰天旗，二曰天苑，三曰九斿。」《文選．楊子雲〈長楊賦〉》：「羅千乘於林莽，列萬騎於山隅。」 「 羅 」是一種稀疏而輕軟的絲織品。《廣韻．歌韻》：「羅，羅綺也。」如《楚辭．招魂》：「蒻阿拂壁，羅幬張些。」王逸注：「羅，綺屬也。張，施也。言房內則以蒻席薄床，四壁及與曲隅復施羅幬，輕且涼也。」《淮南子．主術》：「是猶貫甲冑而入宗廟，被羅紈而從軍旅，失樂之所由生矣。」 「 羅 」通「 罹 」，表示遭遇。如《漢書．雋疏于薛平彭傳》：「羅文法者于公所決皆不恨。」顏師古注：「羅，罹也，遭也。」《論衡．辨祟》：「或有所犯，抵觸縣官，羅麗刑法，不曰過所致，而曰家有負。」 「 羅 」也是一種細密的篩子，同「 籮 」。如《齊民要術．柰林檎》：「下水，更抨，以羅漉去皮子。」明代宋應星《天工開物．粹精》：「凡麥經磨之後，幾番入羅，勤者不厭重復。」又作動詞，表示用羅篩東西。如唐代白居易〈即事〉：「室香羅藥氣，籠暖焙茶煙。」

羅字的基本解释

羅
luó
见“罗”。

羅字的汉语字典释义

[①]［luó］
［《廣韻》魯何切，平歌，來。］
“罗1”的繁体字。
(1)捕鸟的网。
(2)指捕兽的网。
(3)张网捕鸟。
(4)罗致；招请。
(5)包罗。
(6)约束，防范。
(7)陈列。
(8)分布；分散。
(9)阻止；遮拦。
(10)稀疏而轻软的丝织品。
(11)细筛的一种。
(12)用罗筛东西。
(13)英语gross省音译。量词。十二打为一罗。
(14)通“罹”。遭遇。
(15)通“罹”。忧愁。
(16)通“蘿”。女萝。
(17)用同“鑼”。打击乐器，铜制。
(18)用同“籮”。竹编的器物。
(19)古国名。熊姓，在今湖北宜城西。春秋时为楚所灭。
(20)姓。
[②]［luo˙］
“罗2”的繁体字。
语气词。

羅字的康熙字典解释

【未集中】【网字部】　羅； 康熙笔画：20； 页码：页950第12
【廣韻】魯何切【集韻】【韻會】良何切【正韻】朗何切，?音蘿。【說文】以絲罟鳥。古者芒氏初作羅。【爾雅·釋器】鳥罟謂之羅。【註】謂羅絡之。【詩·王風】雉離於羅。【周禮·夏官·羅氏】掌羅烏鳥。　又【類篇】帛也。【釋名】羅文，疎羅也。【戰國策】下宮糅羅紈，曳綺縠。　又【廣雅】羅，列也。【楚辭·九歌】羅生兮堂下。【註】羅列而生。　又國名。【左傳·桓十二年】羅人欲伐之。【註】羅，熊姓國，在宜城縣西山中，後徙。　又水名。【史記·屈原傳】遂自投汨羅。【註】汨水在羅，故曰汨羅。　又新羅，東夷國名。【唐書·東夷傳】新羅，弁韓苗裔也，居漢樂浪地。　又姓。【姓氏急就篇】羅氏，顓頊後，封于羅，今房州也。子孫以爲氏。　又羅羅，獸名。【山海經】北海有獸，狀如虎，名曰羅羅。【駢雅】靑虎謂之羅羅。　又菴羅，果名。【本草】梨之類，色黃，如鵝梨。　又【集韻】鄰知切，音離。義同。　又【集韻】郞佐切，音囉。邏或省作羅。巡也。

Luo
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［luó］
["Guangyun" Lu Heqie, Ping Ge, come. ]
Traditional characters for "罗1".
(1) A bird's net.
(2) Refers to the net for catching animals.
(3) Use a net to catch birds.
(4) Luo Zhi; invite.
(5) Inclusive.
(6) Restriction and prevention.
(7) Display.
(8) Distribution; dispersion.
(9) Prevent; obstruct.
(10) Sparse and soft silk fabrics.
(11) A kind of fine sieve.
(12) Use Luo to sieve things.
(13) English gross provincial transliteration. quantifier. Twelve dozens are one Luo.
(14) Through "suffering". encounter.
(15) Through "suffering". sad.
(16) Through "Luo". Female Luo.
(17) Use the same "gong". Percussion instrument, made of copper.
(18) Use the same as "luo". Utensils made of bamboo.
(19) Ancient country name. Xiong's surname is in the west of Yicheng, Hubei today. It was destroyed by Chu in the Spring and Autumn Period.
(20) Last name.
[②]［luo˙］

Luo
Name meaning
Nothing.
luó, luō
вм. 罗
Radicals: 罒, 糸, 隹  (net, thread, turkey)
Meaning Mnemonic
You have a net of thread for catching a turkey. But, it must be spread out and you must arrange it first.
The reason you'd use a net made of thread is because it's hard to see. But, it's only that way when you spread out the net. It's important to spread out and arrange your net otherwise the turkey will see it.
Reading Mnemonic
You spread out your net and arrange it just so. You expect it to catch a turkey, but instead you catch the ancient Egyptian god Ra (ら).
"Let me out of this net!" says Ra. "You arranged and spread it out just right so I couldn't see it!"
